case.name: Commissioner of Taxation v Grimaldi (No. 3) [2009] FCA 740 (9 July 2009)

citances.sentence: 2 On 9 July 2009 the primary judge dismissed the Commissioner's motion ( Commissioner of Taxation v Grimaldi (No 3) [2009] FCA 740). On that day the primary judge also ordered the appellants to pay one quarter of the Commissioner's costs of the motion. The primary judge stayed the making of the costs order to allow submissions to be made. On 13 July 2009, following the making of submissions, the primary judge confirmed the costs order ( Commissioner of Taxation v Grimaldi (No 8) [2009] FCA 769).

When I declined to make the freezing orders on 9 July 2009 I said at [75] of my reasons for judgment ( Commissioner of Taxation v Grimaldi (No. 3) [2009] FCA 740): '75 In the exercise of my discretion, I do not consider that further freezing orders should be made in respect of the assets of the third and fifth respondents at this stage. I am mindful of the terms of Mr Stewart's email to Aaron Lyne of 17 October 2008, but, since then another restraining order has been made which has been registered in the High Court of New Zealand, the third and fifth respondents have each appeared unconditionally in these proceedings and they have each given undertakings to this Court in the terms indicated above. '
